docs.snippet: Search-engine map sites, like those from Bing, Google and Yahoo, can do more for trip planning than just calculating directions. All three have a setting that shows you the current traffic conditions along the planned route to avoid jams.     Some...
docs.lead_paragraph: Search-engine map sites, like those from Bing, Google and Yahoo, can do more for trip planning than just calculating directions. All three have a setting that shows you the current traffic conditions along the planned route to avoid jams. Some sites are even more helpful. Bing, for example, has a link on its Maps page for its Maps Apps, like a distance calculator and a gasoline price finder. From the drop-down map menu in the upper right corner, Google Maps offers a list of informational layers you can add to the map--including weather conditions, feeds from nearby Webcams and bicycle paths.

docs.snippet: Five months after it introduced a cloud music service with limited capabilities, Google is in negotiations with the major record labels to expand that service and also open an MP3 store that would compete with Apple and Amazon.     According to nu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Five months after it introduced a cloud music service with limited capabilities, Google is in negotiations with the major record labels to expand that service and also open an MP3 store that would compete with Apple and Amazon. According to numerous music executives, Google is eager to open the store in the next several weeks. It would most likely be connected to Google's existing cloud service, Music Beta, which lets people back up their songs on remote servers and stream them to mobile phones and other devices, said these executives, who all spoke on condition of anonymity because the talks were private and continuing.

headline.main: Google Said to Weigh Music Store

docs.abstract: Google is in negotiations with major record labels to expand its cloud music service and open MP3 store that would compete with Apple and Amazon. (M)

headline.main: Complaint Box | The Sympathy Sham

docs.snippet: In this week's Complaint Box: After a writer forks over $20 to a man who says his mother has just had a stroke, she learns via Google that she was not the first one duped....
docs.lead_paragraph: I keep thinking about the guy who took the $20. Who was he? What was his habit, addiction, need? It happened so fast. I was walking to a takeout Chinese place, strolling with my dog on Prospect Place between Underhill and Vanderbilt, near my Brooklyn apartment. I saw the man coming. He was tall, thin and middle-aged, wearing glasses, jeans and a white belt. I smiled and nodded hello as I passed.

headline.main: Complaint Box | The Sympathy Sham

docs.snippet: Four new monthly magazines advising business owners on how to use social media tools will go on sale on Monday. Each publication focuses on one of the major platforms: Twitter, Facebook, Google and LinkedIn.     The magazines, published by GSG Wor...
docs.lead_paragraph: Four new monthly magazines advising business owners on how to use social media tools will go on sale on Monday. Each publication focuses on one of the major platforms: Twitter, Facebook, Google and LinkedIn. The magazines, published by GSG World Media, will cost $7.95 each at Office Depot stores. They will also be free in various digital formats to five million people who will receive an e-mail from Office Depot this week. The magazines are called: Tweeting & Business; LI & Business; fb & Business and The Big G & Business. A related Web site called socialmediamags.com will open on Monday.

headline.main: A Print Focus on Social Media

docs.snippet: UIST, pronounced "wist," stands for User Interface Software and Technology. It's the name of a research conference going on this week in Santa Barbara that showcases what's going on among computer interface researchers at top computer science depa...

headline.main: UIST 2011: Crowdsourcing Research

docs.abstract: UIST, pronounced "wist," stands for User Interface Software and Technology. It's the name of a research conference going on this week in Santa Barbara that showcases what's going on among computer interface researchers at top computer science departments - MIT and Stanford are a major presence - and at companies like Google, Disney and Autodesk. Standing out among the presented research, and especially relevant to news organizations, are the emerging interfaces for crowdsourcing.

docs.snippet: Dedicated smartphone apps for social media networks make it easy to post status updates on the go. Users with regular cellphones can also keep their friends in the loop by simply sending text messages directly to a phone number specified by the si...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dedicated smartphone apps for social media networks make it easy to post status updates on the go. Users with regular cellphones can also keep their friends in the loop by simply sending text messages directly to a phone number specified by the site. A few setup steps may be needed first to get the text-based posting activated, and every service may not work with every wireless carrier, but Facebook, Twitter and Google+ all have guides for getting started. Facebook has instructions for activating mobile texts on its site at on.fb.me /nECPu2 and a guide to text commands for things like updating your status or subscribing to friends' updates at on.fb.me/qOMiYf. Twitter also offers a guide for sending posts by text message at bit.ly/mvKaUq, and Google+ has instructions for its own service at bit.ly /qVrnlQ. While carrier rates for text messages may apply if the service is not included in the overall phone plan, it may still be a cheaper way to keep up with social media when a smartphone and data plan are out of financial reach. J. D. BIERSDORFER

headline.seo: At Waldorf School in Silicon Valley, Technology Can Wait
headline.main: A Silicon Valley School That Doesn’t Compute
headline.print_headline: A Silicon Valley School That Doesn’t Compute

docs.abstract: Waldorf School of the Peninsula in Los Altos, Calif, is one of about 160 Waldorf schools in the country that subscribes to a teaching philosophy that shuns computers and instead focuses on physical activity and learning through creative, hands-on tasks; those who endorse the approach say computers inhibit creative thinking, movement, human interaction and attention spans; school's foothold in tech epicenter Silicon Valley puts into sharp relief intensifying debate about the role of computers in education. (Series: Grading the Digital School)

docs.snippet: In the early 1900s, John Wanamaker, a political figure and well-known merchant, coined one of the most famous quotes about advertising: ''Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted. The trouble is, I don't know which half.''     For the past ...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the early 1900s, John Wanamaker, a political figure and well-known merchant, coined one of the most famous quotes about advertising: ''Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted. The trouble is, I don't know which half.'' For the past century that observation has remained true, but that is slowly changing as online companies start delivering real-time analytics about Web surfers and the ads they see. It could be used for social networking advertising - an area that Google is poised to enter with its new social network, Google+.

headline.main: Google Rolls Out Visualization Tools

byline.original: By NICK BILTON and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

docs.snippet: As a host of potential bidders circle Yahoo, several of Silicon Valley's biggest companies are considering whether to jump into the fray themselves.     Microsoft and Google are both weighing whether to participate in the bidding. Each has its own...
docs.lead_paragraph: As a host of potential bidders circle Yahoo, several of Silicon Valley's biggest companies are considering whether to jump into the fray themselves. Microsoft and Google are both weighing whether to participate in the bidding. Each has its own business reasons for wanting to see the continued existence of Yahoo, which despite its financial struggles still has a monthly audience of almost 700 million unique visitors.

headline.main: Tech Giants Sizing Up Yahoo Bid

docs.abstract: Microsoft and Google are considering lending financial support to private equity firms or others mulling a bid for Yahoo; each has its own business reasons for wanting to see continued existence of Yahoo, which has monthly audience of almost 700 million unique visitors. Photo (M)/

docs.snippet: Here's a dose of politics, Silicon Valley style. Two investors, Ron Conway and Sean Parker, have teamed up to finance a promotional video for a San Francisco mayoral candidate, Ed Lee, reports TechCrunch. The two-minute video, a remake of M.C. Ham...

headline.main: Too Legit to Watch

docs.abstract: Here's a dose of politics, Silicon Valley style. Two investors, Ron Conway and Sean Parker, have teamed up to finance a promotional video for a San Francisco mayoral candidate, Ed Lee, reports TechCrunch. The two-minute video, a remake of M.C. Hammer's 1991 song "Too Legit to Quit," stars Twitter's co-founder, Biz Stone; a Google executive, Marissa Mayer; Will.i.am of the Black Eyed Peas; and yes, Mr. Hammer.

docs.abstract: Here's a dose of politics, Silicon Valley style. Two investors, Ron Conway and Sean Parker, have teamed up to finance a promotional video for a San Francisco mayoral candidate, Ed Lee, reports TechCrunch. The two-minute video, a remake of M.C. Hammer's 1991 song "Too Legit to Quit," stars Twitter's co-founder, Biz Stone; a Google executive, Marissa Mayer; Will.i.am of the Black Eyed Peas; and yes, Mr. Hammer.

byline.original: By BRIAN STELTER and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

docs.snippet: It appears that investors are flocking to Groupon's forthcoming initial public offering like customers to one of the daily deal giant's coupons. The company is considering raising the price of its shares above its current expected range of $16 to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It appears that investors are flocking to Groupon's forthcoming initial public offering like customers to one of the daily deal giant's coupons. The company is considering raising the price of its shares above its current expected range of $16 to $18 a share, people briefed on the matter said Friday. That would value the online coupon pioneer at potentially more than $12 billion. The company's executives and bankers, led by Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and Credit Suisse, have completed the first week of a multistate road show.

headline.main: Google Weighs Raising It's Public Offering Price

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and EVELYN M. RUSLI

docs.snippet: On Wednesday, Mayor Michael Bloomberg went to Union Square to welcome Yelp, the latest Silicon Valley company  to put down roots in Manhattan.      ''This is the latest proof that New York is on its way to becoming a Number One digital hub,'' Mr. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, Mayor Michael Bloomberg went to Union Square to welcome Yelp, the latest Silicon Valley company to put down roots in Manhattan. ''This is the latest proof that New York is on its way to becoming a Number One digital hub,'' Mr. Bloomberg said, during a press conference held at the Yelp offices. Yelp follows in the footsteps of Accel Partners, a noted venture capital firm, and Twitter, which opened its New York offices earlier this month. Facebook and Google already have well-established presences in Manhattan.

headline.main: Yelp Welcomed To New York
